testproblem.name: PrescribedNormalFlow_DG

variables.variable: import os files = os.listdir("./") solvers_converged = not "matrixdump" in files and not "matrixdump.info" in files

from fluidity_tools import stat_parser s=stat_parser("Presc_normal_flow.stat") stats={} stats["MaxU"]=s["Water"]["Velocity%magnitude"]["max"][-1] stats["MaxU1"]=s["Water"]["Velocity%1"]["max"][-1] stats["MaxU2"]=s["Water"]["Velocity%2"]["max"][-1]

testproblem.pass_tests:
assert(solvers_converged)
assert(0.0045 < stats["MaxU"]<0.055) assert(0.035 < stats["MaxU1"]<0.04) assert(0.035 < stats["MaxU2"]<0.04)>
testproblem.comment: This problem tests a spatially constant flow through a channel at 45 degrees to the axes with no slip BCs on the edge. Flow is forced in the inflow and outflow via a prescribed normal boundary condition
